meanings.definition: Work done before the main task or activity.
meanings.sent1: I always do my prework before starting a big project.
meanings.sent2: The prework involved organizing all the materials needed for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The prework of setting up the stage turned into a fun puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous prework was the foundation for the successful event.
meanings.sent5: The prework of creating a detailed plan made the project run smoothly.

meanings.definition: To prepare or complete tasks before the main work begins.
meanings.sent1: She likes to prework by making lists of what needs to be done.
meanings.sent2: We need to prework the equipment before the event starts.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prework by double-checking all the details.
meanings.sent4: Preworking the schedule helped avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent5: The team preworked diligently to ensure everything was ready on time.
